questions.explanation:
7. Which flowers should we get for Ms. Jones?
(A) I'm sure she'll be happy to switch with you. → Incorrect (unrelated to flower selection)
(B) She would like the yellow ones. → Correct (specifies the preferred flowers)
(C) She's the only one who received the report. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Did you put paper in the copy machine?
(A) I remember that manager very well. → Incorrect (unrelated to the copy machine)
(B) I use notebooks for taking notes. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) No, someone already did that. → Correct (addresses whether paper was added)

9. Can you help me test the new voice mail system?
(A) No, I have a meeting that's about to start. → Correct (responds to the request for help)
(B) I wasn't aware that he sent an e-mail. → Incorrect (unrelated to testing the system)
(C) Yes, I pay my phone bill online. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. Why is the marketing team in the conference room?
(A) The office near the lobby. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)
(B) Because they are attending a training seminar. → Correct (explains the team's presence)
(C) Those reports are highly regarded. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

11. Who is the new committee member going to be?
(A) A lawyer from New York. → Correct (identifies the new committee member)
(B) At the shop next door. → Incorrect (refers to location, not person)
(C) Most of his clients. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. Why didn't we order more of the same chairs?
(A) You heard all of them? → Incorrect (unrelated to the reason)
(B) Because they're very expensive. → Correct (explains why more chairs weren't ordered)
(C) I don't think I'll make it. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

13. How many projects have been approved?
(A) One for each department. → Correct (specifies the number of projects)
(B) I'm going to cook my specialty tonight. → Incorrect (unrelated to projects)
(C) Just a projector, please. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

14. Were you running late this morning?
(A) Yes, two please. → Incorrect (unrelated to being late)
(B) She enjoys exercising in the park. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) No, I've been here for an hour. → Correct (addresses punctuality)

15. We should leave early for the restaurant.
(A) Yes, it can be difficult to find parking. → Correct (agrees and provides a reason)
(B) A detailed process. → Incorrect (unrelated to leaving early)
(C) I started the design early in the day. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the restaurant)

16. Why did the price of these shoes increase?
(A) Not after what happened last week. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) There is a new manufacturing process. → Correct (explains the price increase)
(C) Everyone who heard the announcement. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. Have you written down the instructions for how to operate the machine?
(A) A recent development. → Incorrect (unrelated to instructions)
(B) Thank you for doing that. → Incorrect (assumes action not confirmed)
(C) Yes, I placed them beside it. → Correct (confirms instructions were written)

18. How did you choose your dentist?
(A) I have a new doctor. → Incorrect (unrelated to dentist choice)
(B) I once wanted to be a teacher. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) A friend recommended one to me. → Correct (explains the selection process)

19. We should send out the invitations for her retirement party.
(A) Actually, I don't remember. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) I didn't see who wrote it. → Incorrect (irrelevant to sending invitations)
(C) I already did that. → Correct (confirms the task was completed)

20. Have you begun planning a vacation?
(A) I've already used all of my time off. → Correct (implies no vacation planning due to lack of time)
(B) It's a nice place to visit. → Incorrect (unrelated to planning)
(C) It seems unlikely they did. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. Where should I look for a used car?
(A) A low price. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not location)
(B) Sorry, I'm not very hungry. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I have a friend who is selling one. → Correct (suggests where to look)

22. Didn't Insook move into that office four months ago?
(A) I don't think Insook has copies of those. → Incorrect (unrelated to office move)
(B) I think that's what I heard. → Correct (confirms the office move)
(C) A four o'clock departure. → Incorrect (refers to time, not move)

23. Would you like me to type up the proposal for you?
(A) Which kind did you buy? → Incorrect (unrelated to the proposal)
(B) Yes, they saw it. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the offer)
(C) That would be very helpful. → Correct (accepts the offer to type)

24. We should print more business cards.
(A) I'm not sure how useful they would be. → Correct (responds to the suggestion)
(B) A candlemaker. → Incorrect (unrelated to business cards)
(C) Let me know if she arrives. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. Can I have a copy of the sales report?
(A) Only the original location. → Incorrect (unrelated to providing a copy)
(B) The printer is broken. → Correct (explains inability this answer)
(C) She helps the senior manager. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)

26. When do you need to renew your passport?
(A) Not since I was at university. → Incorrect (unrelated to renewal timing)
(B) It won't expire for a while yet. → Correct (addresses renewal timing)
(C) I completed more than I expected. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Do you have this shirt in a larger size?
(A) I don't work here. → Correct (explains inability to help with the request)
(B) I brought some more hangers. → Incorrect (unrelated to shirt size)
(C) A very suitable color. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Aren't you planning to buy some supplies today?
(A) I have a very busy schedule this afternoon. → Correct (explains why supplies may not be bought)
(B) The closet down the hall. → Incorrect (refers to location, not plan)
(C) A member of the committee. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

29. Mary's promotion was well deserved, don't you think?
(A) Yes, they've known each other for about ten years. → Incorrect (unrelated to the promotion)
(B) Yes, Mary has put in a lot of overtime lately. → Correct (agrees and supports the promotion)
(C) Mary will go on vacation next month. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

30. Should we go ahead with the project or postpone it?
(A) Let's check the budget first. → Correct (suggests a practical next step)
(B) That's a really good idea. → Incorrect (does not address the choice)
(C) She'll be at that meeting. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. Is Mr. Hernandez joining us for dinner?
(A) Haven't you seen the guest list? → Correct (implies checking for Mr. Hernandez's attendance)
(B) Can he turn it in tomorrow instead? → Incorrect (unrelated to dinner)
(C) I'll put it upstairs for now. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
